example.code:
PS C:\>$tag = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Tag PS C:\>$tag.Key = "Name" PS C:\>$tag.Value = "My instance"
PS C:\>New-EC2Tag -Resource "i-1a2b3c4d" -Tag $tag
example.description: Tags instance i-1a2b3c4d with the name "My instance".
Tags instance i-1a2b3c4d with the name "My instance". This more concise version requires PowerShell v3 or higher.

example.code: New-EC2Tag -Resource "i-1a2b3c4d" -Tag @( @{ Key="Name"; Value="My instance" }, @{ Key="Test"; Value="Another tag value" } )
example.description: Updates the tags for the specified instance, causing the Name tag value to be set to "My instance" and a new tag, "Test" to be added with the value 'Another tag value'. This more concise version requires PowerShell v3 or higher. PowerShell v2 users should use New-Object to instantiate the Tag instances to be passed to the -Tags parameter.

example.code: PS C:\>New-EC2Tag -Resource @( "i-1a2b3c4d", "i-4d3c2b1a" ) ` -Tag @( @{ Key="Name"; Value="My instance" }, ` @{ Key="Test"; Value="Another tag value" } )
example.description: This example, for PowerShell v3 or higher, shows how to apply multiple tags to multiple instances.
